Hyderabad student killed in US: 800+ Indian student deaths since 2018; US leads the list
description: A Hyderabad student, Chandrashekar Pole, was fatally shot in Dallas while working part-time, highlighting ongoing safety concerns for Indian students abroad. Data from the Ministry of External Affairs, reported by Dataful, shows 842 Indian student deaths overseas between 2018 and 2024, with the US leading at 141 deaths. Most fatalities were due to medical causes, suicides, and accidents. The data calls for urgent action from policymakers, universities, and families to improve student safety and support.

title: Female admissions at IITs stuck at 20%: Policy met its quota; deeper barriers remain
description: Despite policy interventions like the Supernumerary Seats Scheme, female enrolment in IIT BTech programmes remains stagnant at around 20% as of 2025. While the number of women admitted has risen in absolute terms, the proportional share has seen minimal growth since 2020. Social, cultural, and institutional barriers—including safety concerns, high coaching costs, and confidence gaps—continue to limit access. Data over five years highlights the need for deeper reforms beyond reserved seats.

description: Advisers to Pakistan’s military chief proposed a $1.2 billion port at Pasni to US officials, aiming to transport critical minerals and offer Washington a strategic presence. This initiative, part of a broader effort to strengthen ties with the Trump administration, seeks to diversify Pakistan's options and counterbalance China's influence.

Jeff Bezos makes bold prediction: 'The next data centres will be built in space'
description: Jeff Bezos predicts space-based data centers within 10-20 years, leveraging uninterrupted solar power for unmatched efficiency. These orbital facilities would revolutionize AI training and cloud computing, overcoming terrestrial limitations. He believes technological advances will make them feasible despite high costs, comparing AI's boom to the internet's early surge.

title: Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli fit and key for India: Ajit Agarkar
description: BCCI chief selector Ajit Agarkar confirmed Shubman Gill as India's new ODI captain, consolidating leadership across formats. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will remain key players for the Australia tour, having passed fitness tests, despite playing only one format. Rohit is expected to open with Gill, balancing experience with fresh leadership.

Unauthorized shop and house extensions were also removed in Sailani.

description: Shubman Gill has been named India's ODI captain, replacing Rohit Sharma, as part of a strategic move to consolidate leadership across formats. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar cited long-term planning for the 2027 World Cup and the impracticality of having three different captains. Gill, already Test captain, also serve as T20I vice-captain under Suryakumar Yadav.

description: The Election Commission met political parties on Saturday. They discussed Bihar assembly polls. Parties urged polls after the Chhath festival. They also asked for fewer phases. Reforms like voter cap and Form 17C were welcomed. Janata Dal (United) sought a single-phase election. BJP asked agents to collect Form 17C. Election dates will be announced soon.

His counsel sought preservation of evidence and specific provisions for his stay, on which the court sought police response.

description: Protests in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir concluded after an agreement. The Pakistan government and protestors signed a 25-point charter. This followed days of violence and unrest in the region. The deal includes compensation for victims and significant developmental measures. Key provisions cover education, health, and electricity improvements. Administrative reforms and infrastructure projects are also part of the agreement.

Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu also prepared to implement the plan's first stage. The proposal outlines a deradicalized Gaza, technocratic governance, and a pathway to Palestinian self-determination, with Trump overseeing redevelopment efforts.

First major legal challenge hits Trump’s $100K H-1B visa overhaul - Here’s what to know
description: A coalition of unions, educators, and advocacy groups has filed the first major lawsuit against President Trump’s $100,000 H-1B visa fee, calling it unlawful and harmful to US industries. Filed in California federal court, the case challenges presidential authority, citing risks to innovation, healthcare, and education. The outcome could reshape immigration policy and global talent flow.

title: Emma Raducanu’s IG nod to Taylor Swift’s ‘The Life of a Showgirl’
description: Emma Raducanu publicly supported Taylor Swift's new album, "The Life of a Showgirl," on Instagram on October 3, 2025, amidst its mixed reception. This gesture followed Raducanu's mixed 2025 tennis season, which included recent losses but also a strong semifinal performance. Her musical interests connect her with fans beyond the court.

title: Kyren Lacy controversy: Lawyer claims ex-LSU WR wrongly blamed in fatal crash
description: Former LSU player Kyren Lacy's suicide, ahead of negligent homicide charges, sparks controversy. His attorney, Matt Ory, challenges the Louisiana State Police investigation into a fatal accident. New surveillance footage reportedly shows Lacy was back in his lane before impact, contradicting official accounts. Ory cites inconsistencies and missing witness testimony, suggesting evidence doesn't support Lacy's culpability, deepening the tragedy.

title: Ray of hope for advanced breast cancer patients: US approves new oral drug Inluriyo
description: The FDA has approved Inluriyo, a first-in-class oral therapy for ESR1-mutated advanced breast cancer, marking a significant breakthrough. This new drug targets hormone-resistant tumors by blocking estrogen receptors, reducing the risk of disease progression or death by 33-38%. Inluriyo offers a convenient pill alternative, bringing new hope to patients.

title: ‘Op Gaanjaney’: How ATS tracked ex-NSG commando in 200kg drug bust; kingpin had political ambitions
description: Rajasthan ATS apprehended former NSG commando Bajrang Singh, wanted in a 200kg ganja smuggling case. Singh, who served in the 26/11 Mumbai operation and retired in 2021, became a narcotics kingpin, leveraging local connections after failed political ambitions. He was tracked for two months using technical intelligence and informers, culminating in his arrest under 'Operation Gaanjaney'.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; scheduled services will..
description: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. Despite this, the US Embassy in India confirmed that scheduled visa and passport services will continue. The embassy's X account will only provide urgent safety and security updates during this period.

title: US Army warns: Military network at ‘very high risk’; sends memo to these companies
description: The US Army's chief technology officer issued a memo labeling the new NGC2 battlefield communications network, developed by Palantir and Anduril, as "very high risk" due to fundamental security flaws. Concerns include uncontrolled data access, unmonitored user actions, and unverified software security, potentially allowing adversaries persistent access and misuse of classified information.

title: Stephen A. Smith on Shedeur Sanders’ 'silence' amid Browns QB drama
description: Shedeur Sanders made headlines in Cleveland on October 1, 2025. He remained silent during a press conference. Stephen A. Smith defended his actions, calling judgment unfair. Cam Newton discussed Sanders' brand value for the Browns. Both analysts agreed his true test would come only when he steps onto the field.

title: Gisele Bündchen finds healing in nature and family as ex-husband Tom Brady watches afar
description: Gisele Bündchen, 45, embraces a new chapter, sharing glimpses of her seven-month-old baby boy, life with Joaquim Valente, and her deep connection to nature. Her recent Instagram post highlighted a tender photo of her newborn and a message of mindfulness, showing her grounded lifestyle in Brazil focused on family and healing.
